result.name: Elderly Care and Caring for the Disabled
result.headline: In this course learn how to treat people suffering from various mental and physical health conditions, as a result of ageing and traumatic injuries.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Differentiate between the process of ageing and disability
  • Describe the manner in which a range of the body’s systems deteriorate as the body ages
  • Discuss the implications the deterioration of a client's body has on a care worker’s duties
  • List a range of medical conditions that people suffer as a result of ageing
  • Develop the skills necessary to identify and treat various medical conditions
  • Realise that people with the same disability often have unique needs
  • Discuss various spinal cord injuries and the effects they have on individuals and their lifestyles

result.name: Medication Safety: Handling and Administration
result.headline: Enhance safety in medication handling and administration practices effectively with this free online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Describe the medication administration process to ensure patient safety
  • Identify essential components of prescriptions for medication efficacy
  • Review techniques for various medication administration routes
  • Evaluate safe medication storage, handling, and disposal practices
  • Identify common signs and symptoms of adverse drug reactions and side effects
  • Illustrate the importance of accurate medication assessment and management in home care settings
  • Distinguish between medication administration in-home care and long-term care facilities
  • Outline the role of drug scheduling in controlled substance regulation and its healthcare implications
  • Discuss medication handlers' legal responsibilities on practice scope, liability, and patient safety
  • State the ethical considerations in medication handling
  • Summarise the function of global medication regulatory bodies
  • Analyse the common causes of medication errors

result.name: Caregiving Skills - Dementia Care
result.headline: Learn more about the caregiving skills you need for working effectively with clients who are suffering from dementia.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Define and differentiate various forms of dementia and their symptoms
  • Describe the symptoms of early, mild and late stages of Alzheimer’s disease
  • Discuss the importance of providing a variety of activities to patients with dementia, on a day-to-day basis
  • Summarise a range of problem behaviours that are associated with Alzheimer’s disease and describe how to treat them
  • Identify the skills to help families when a loved one has been diagnosed with dementia
  • Describe common behavioural traits exhibited by people with dementia and discuss effective ways to treat them

result.name: Asbestos Awareness
result.headline: This free online health and safety course explains how to manage the risks posed by the carcinogens found in asbestos.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Explain what asbestos is, how it is produced and why it is dangerous
  • Identify the types of asbestos that are commonly used to manufacture products
  • Describe the hazardous properties and forms of asbestos
  • List the most probable locations where asbestos can be found
  • Identify the most important route of exposure to asbestos that leads to unwanted health effects
  • Describe the health effects of asbestos exposure and contributing factors to asbestos-related diseases
  • Discuss who is at a greater risk of asbestos exposure
  • Explain the strategies and control measures used to avoid asbestos exposure
  • Outline the workplace exposure limits for asbestos established by different international organisations
  • Summarise the steps taken by licensed asbestos professionals to remove asbestos
  • Discuss the safety measures that provide effective asbestos waste management

result.name: HIPAA Compliance Essentials
result.headline: Learn HIPAA essentials, compliance best practices, and consequences of violations with this free online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Explain the definition and purpose of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)
  • Identify the roles and responsibilities of Covered Entities and Business Associates under HIPAA
  • Discuss the rights individuals have over their health information
  • Analyse how encryption and access controls help protect PHI from unauthorized access
  • Evaluate best practices for securely handling, storing, and disposing of PHI to prevent unauthorized access
  • List the key steps involved in establishing a HIPAA compliance program
  • Outline the most common types of HIPAA violations and how they occur
  • Recall real-world examples of HIPAA breaches and their consequences

result.name: Food Safety Training - Safe Practices and Procedures
result.headline: Learn more about the food sanitation practices and procedures with this food safety training online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Describe sanitary food handling practices
  • List correct cleaning and sanitizing procedures
  • Outline safe practices in the food preparation area to avoid accidents
  • List personal cleanliness guidelines for handling food
  • Describe the role and influence of the manager in the food service sanitation and safety operation
  • Recall the OSHA regulations for reporting incidents

result.name: Mental Health Studies - Suicide, Violent Behavior and Substance Abuse
result.headline: Learn to identify mental health problems and the importance of reducing the stigma of mental illness today.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Identify the signs and types of suicidal behaviors
  • List conditions that are linked to the risk of suicide
  • Identify the most common precipitating factors in violent behavior
  • Identify the methods used to manage the violent patient who is unarmed or armed
  • Describe the factors impacting the effect of the particular substance on the individual
  • Recall the long and short-term effects of substance abuse
  • Identify the signs/symptoms and treatment for overdose and withdrawal of alcohol, opioids and barbiturates
  • Identify behavior changes resulting from substance abuse
  • Describe body mechanism adjustments and tolerance levels to substances

result.name: Working with Students with Special Educational Needs
result.headline: Improve your special education teaching methods with this free online course to make a greater impact in the classroom.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Describe the fundamentals of special education
  • Outline the most common disabilities encountered in the classroom
  • Outline a basic individual education plan (IEP) for a student with special educational needs
  • Identify strategies for teaching students with intellectual disabilities
  • Identify the correct definition for a 'behavioural disorder'
  • List three strategies for teaching students with hearing loss
  • Describe three strategies for teaching students with visual impairment.

result.name: Basics of Safeguarding Children
result.headline: Learn important strategies to protect children from various forms of abuse with this free online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Recall some myths and truths about safeguarding children
  • Discuss the importance of safeguarding training
  • Explain the UK's Children Act and the child protection system in England
  • List various types of child abuse
  • Identify the signs and impact of sexual abuse on children
  • Outline the steps to take after an abused child has been referred to childcare services
  • Recall what to do when a child discloses abuse to you

result.name: Introduction to Caregiving
result.headline: Learn about caregiving skills including legal and ethical responsibilities, and working as part of a team.
result.outcomes:
Having completed this course you will be able to:

  • Define the roles and responsibilities of a carer.
  • Describe the various legal issues that carers must be familiar with when they work with clients.
  • Develop the skills necessary to communicate effectively with all members of the care service team.
  • Develop an understanding of how to communicate with individuals with various disabilities.
  • Discuss the correct etiquette when working with a wheelchair-bound client.
  • Outline the causes and effects of stress and the most efficient ways of preventing and managing it.
  • Develop the time management and organizational skills necessary to provide efficient care for clients.

result.name: Medication Management and Administration
result.headline: Learn the best practices for ensuring medication safety through proper medicine management in this free online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Discuss the numerous benefits of proper medication management
  • Recognise the legal consideration of medication administration
  • Identify the roles and responsibilities of healthcare professionals in medication management
  • Distinguish between the various medication administration methods
  • Recall safety guidelines to be followed when administering medications
  • Explain the importance and principles of accurate medication documentation
  • Explain how pediatric doses are typically determined and the need for careful calculation
  • Recall the different units of measurement with their uses in medication calculations
  • Recognise the standard formula used in healthcare to calculate medication dosages
  • Identify the correct formula for calculating the infusion rate in mL/hr
  • State safety standards healthcare professionals should adhere to when administering medications
  • Discuss important considerations for pregnancy medication

result.name: Construction Safety and Health
result.headline: Learn about best practice in construction health and safety with this free online safety training course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Describe the SMP20
  • Outline the different sections in the SMP20
  • Discuss forms in SMP20
  • Identify key Identify the key regulations that govern safety at work in construction
  • Define hazard, risk, and control measures
  • Describe the SSWP document
  • Describe the duties of different groups of people when it comes to scaffolding work
  • Describe the features of different types of scaffold
  • Discuss common hazards and risk controls that can occur when doing scaffolding work
  • Define demolition work
  • Discuss the process of noise assessment

result.name: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP)
result.headline: This free online food safety course lays out the seven steps of HACCP to help you prevent food contamination hazards.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Define ‘HACCP’ and describe its history and purpose
  • Outline the seven basic principles of HACCP
  • Summarize the various categories of food safety hazards
  • Explain how to apply risk analysis to food safety
  • Describe the process of evaluating, managing, and communicating risk
  • Discuss required programmes and their importance in the HACCP plan
  • Explain how to implement and maintain your HACCP plan

result.name: Fundamentals of Manual Handling
result.headline: Learn how to manage the risks associated with manual handling and lifting in this free online health and safety course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Define ‘manual handling’ and lay out its four key areas
  • Discuss how to recognise and prevent manual handling injuries
  • Explain how to carry out manual handling risk assessments 
  • Analyse the role of legislation relevant to the health and safety aspects of manual handling
  • Outline how to determine the maximum weight you can safely handle
  • Describe the proper technique for lifting heavy weights

result.name: An Introduction to Good Lab Practices
result.headline: In this free online course, learn about the systems and principles involved in good laboratory practices.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Discuss the laboratory guidelines and precautions
  • Describe the contents of the material safety data sheet (MSDS)
  • Explain the components of liquid handling systems in the laboratory
  • Discuss the uses of the water distillation unit
  • Describe the different types of centrifuges
  • Explain the roles of different buffer solutions
  • Discuss the importance of keeping a laboratory notebook
  • Describe the factors that influence centrifugation

result.name: Health and Safety for Caregiving
result.headline: Learn how to provide pain relief, improve strength, increase range of motion and perform types of physical therapy.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Discuss the universal precautions that a care worker must take when working with a client
  • Describe the importance of clients receiving sufficient nutrition and hydration
  • Recognize and prevent all forms of foodborne illnesses
  • List the actions that should be taken in an emergency with a client
  • Recall the symptoms of a range of illnesses and describe how to prevent and treat them
  • Explain how to prepare meals for clients with special dietary requirements
  • Recall how to call for emergency assistance in a calm and professional manner
  • Paraphrase the usual fire safety precautions and what to do in the event of a fire

result.name: Drugs and Alcohol - Awareness and Prevention
result.headline: Learn how to help people make better choices to prevent drug and alcohol misuse in this free online wellness course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Classify drugs by source, legal status and effect on the central nervous system
  • Describe how addiction starts and the role of the brain in addiction
  • Recall the myths and misconceptions regarding the use of drugs and alcohol
  • Define ‘drugs’
  • Discuss the historical context of drugs and their use in the modern era
  • Recognise the short- and long-term effects of drugs and alcohol on the body and mind
  • Analyse the relationship between mental health and substance abuse and misuse
  • Evaluate the signs, risk factors and interventions required for overdoses
  • Discuss the social implications of drugs and alcohol
  • Explain how to enhance self-awareness and resist peer pressure to prevent drug and alcohol misuse
  • Recognise the signs of substance abuse in others and explain how to intervene
  • Outline the importance of early intervention in helping people addicted to drugs and alcohol

result.name: Lean Six Sigma: Yellow Belt
result.headline: Boost efficiency and solve problems effectively for your organisation or business in this free online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Define the principles of Lean Six Sigma in organisational contexts
  • Describe the core concepts of Lean and Six Sigma practices
  • Summarise the phases of the DMAIC methodology clearly
  • Identify the purpose of Define phase tools for project goals
  • Analyse data using Measure and Analyse phase tools effectively
  • Apply Improve and Control phase tools to sustain outcomes
  • Explain Yellow Belt responsibilities in project environments
  • Recognise opportunities for process improvement initiatives
  • Evaluate methods to sustain a Lean Six Sigma culture
  • Discuss the impact of Lean Six Sigma through case studies
  • Compare Lean Six Sigma tools across different project phases
  • Illustrate the link between DMAIC steps and project success

result.name: Anger Management: A Guide to Emotional Regulation and Conflict Resolution
result.headline: Gain essential skills for healthier emotions, relationships, and conflict resolution in this free online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Identify the effects of anger on both the body and mind
  • Outline personal triggers and stressors that lead to anger
  • Define anger journaling and its use in identifying and understanding emotional patterns related to anger
  • Apply relaxation techniques to control physiological responses to anger
  • Change personal beliefs and values that negatively influence anger responses
  • Identify and record personal negative thoughts and triggers as part of cognitive restructuring techniques
  • Analyse conflict types and resolution methods
  • Discuss the interplay between anger, health, and substance abuse
  • Create a plan for managing emotions and preventing relapse
  • Create a personalised anger management plan incorporating cognitive and emotional strategies
  • Apply problem-solving and negotiation skills to resolve workplace conflicts effectively

result.name: Physical Education - Coaching Styles and Techniques
result.headline: Learn about the different types of coaching styles and coaching techniques from this free online course
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Describe the effectiveness of a coach in improving team performance and the elements that good coaches should consider
  • Illustrate effective coaching styles and techniques
  • Explain legal ergogenic aids that need to be considered in physical activity
  • Explain illegal ergogenic aids such as amphetamines, ephedrine, beta-blockers, anabolic steroids and many others
  • Describe sports psychology, limits to performance, sporting injuries
  • Identify recreational and physical activities for different groups within a society
  • Describe how physical activity affects different social groups as children, teenagers, adults and the elderly

result.name: Lockout Tagout (LOTO) Awareness
result.headline: This free online health and safety course explains how to use Lockout Tagout (LOTO) protocols to manage energy hazards.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Define ‘Lockout Tagout’ (LOTO) and describe its purpose and benefits
  • Outline the Lockout Tagout regulations of different countries
  • Explain the essential elements of a successful Lockout Tagout programme
  • Define ‘hazardous energy’ and identify energy sources that require LOTO procedures
  • Discuss when Lockout Tagout is necessary and when exceptions to LOTO can be made
  • Describe the roles and responsibilities of authorised and affected employees in the context of LOTO
  • Identify different types of Lockout Tagout devices
  • Summarise the six-step approach to applying Lockout Tagout (LOTO) procedures on machines or equipment
  • Explain how to remove Lockout Tagout devices like guards
  • Outline the group LOTO procedures

result.name: Introduction to Autism Awareness and Support
result.headline: Learn how to support people with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) in this free online autism awareness course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Identify the signs and symptoms of autism
  • Recognise the most common causes and types of autism
  • Explain the importance of a person-centred approach to helping those with ASD
  • Outline various autism communication strategies
  • Describe how to increase autism awareness
  • Discuss how to enhance social skills among children with autism
  • Explain how to support adults and children with ASD

result.name: Hydrogen Sulphide Safety Training
result.headline: Learn how to identify, prevent and respond to hydrogen sulphide exposure in the workplace in this free online course.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Identify the physical and chemical properties of hydrogen sulphide (H2S)
  • Recognise sources of H2S exposure in different workplaces
  • Evaluate the risks associated with the exposure to H2S
  • Select the right equipment for the detection and monitoring of H2S
  • Outline various control measures to reduce H2S exposure, including risk assessment and the use of PPEs
  • Discuss various strategies required for addressing emergencies arising from H2S exposure
  • List components integral to the effectiveness of H2S training programs
  • Recall different engineering and administrative control measures to mitigate the risks of H2S exposure

result.name: HACCP Food Safety System for Restaurants and Other Catering Services
result.headline: In this free online course, learn how to implement the HACCP Food Safety System in your catering establishment.
result.outcomes:
By the end of this course, you will be able to:

  • Define the ‘catering industry’ and its different types
  • Discuss the importance of food safety in the catering industry
